column1: In the meantime the distant thunder gave notice of a shower at hand
column2: and just as we reached Polley's tavern the rain poured down in torrents. It was soon over
column3: the cloud passing in the direction of the turnpike toward Providence. In a few moments after
column4: a respectable-looking man in a chaise stopped at the door. The man and child in the chair having excited some little sympathy among the passengers
column5: the gentleman was asked if he had observed them. He said he had met them; that the man seemed bewildered
column6: and inquired the way to Boston; that he was driving at great speed
column7: as though he expected to outstrip the tempest; that the moment he had passed him a thunderclap broke distinctly over the man's head and seemed to envelop both man and child
column9: said the gentleman, supposing the lightning had struck him
column10: but the horse only seemed to loom up and increase his speed
column12: as well as I could judge
column13: he travelled just as fast as the thunder cloud."
